component.name: Header
component.description: Page-level header with title, badge, metadata, actions, and optional sticky scroll condensation.

useCases: Top-of-page header for detail or settings pages
Sticky header that condenses on scroll for long-scrolling views
Page headers with tab navigation below the title row
Dashboard headers with summary stats and action buttons

commonPatterns.name: sticky-with-tabs
commonPatterns.description: Sticky header with tabs for page-level navigation
commonPatterns.composition: <Header variant="sticky" title="Settings" badge={<Badge>Pro</Badge>} metadata="Last updated 2 hours ago" actions={<Button variant="primary" size="md">Save</Button>} tabs={<TabsList variant="line"><TabsTrigger value="general">General</TabsTrigger><TabsTrigger value="billing">Billing</TabsTrigger></TabsList>} />

commonPatterns.name: sticky-simple
commonPatterns.description: Sticky header without tabs — border rendered automatically

commonPatterns.name: fixed-page-title
commonPatterns.description: Static page header without sticky behavior or background

commonPatterns.name: with-right-metadata
commonPatterns.description: Header with a price or summary stat to the left of actions
commonPatterns.composition: <Header variant="sticky" title="Invoice #1234" badge={<Badge variant="success">Paid</Badge>} rightMetadata="$1,250.00" actions={<Button variant="outline" size="md">Download</Button>} />

antiPatterns.reason: Tabs slot only renders in sticky variant
antiPatterns.alternative: Use variant="sticky" when tabs are needed

antiPatterns.scenario: Placing Header inside a scrollable Card or container without scrollContainerRef
antiPatterns.reason: Scroll detection defaults to window — sticky behavior will not activate inside nested scrollable containers
antiPatterns.alternative: Pass scrollContainerRef pointing to the scrollable parent element

antiPatterns.reason: Header is a page-level component; multiples create confusing hierarchy
antiPatterns.alternative: Use one Header at the top; use section headings with h2/h3 elsewhere

semanticMeaning.sticky: Pins to viewport top with background, border, and shadow; condenses title and metadata on scroll
semanticMeaning.fixed: Static page header with no background, border, shadow, or scroll behavior

slots.title: String rendered as h1 — required
slots.badge: ReactNode displayed inline next to the title
slots.metadata: ReactNode below title in default state; shifts inline when condensed (sticky only)
slots.rightMetadata: ReactNode to the left of action buttons (e.g., price, stat)
slots.actions: ReactNode for action buttons on the right side
slots.tabs: ReactNode for tab navigation below the heading row (sticky only)

parentConstraints: Should be the first child in the page layout; for sticky, place before scrollable content

interactions.scroll: In sticky variant, header condenses when scrollY > 10px: padding reduces, title shrinks, metadata moves inline
interactions.hover: No hover interactions on the header itself

responsive.mobile: Actions wrap below the title row; full width layout
responsive.desktop: Title and actions sit on one row; metadata inline when condensed

accessibility.keyboardSupport: Tab to navigate action buttons and tab triggers
accessibility.screenReader: Title is h1; metadata and badge are read in document order
accessibility.focusManagement: No special focus management; action buttons and tabs handle their own focus

rules: Use variant="sticky" for most page headers; use variant="fixed" for simple page titles without scroll behavior
Tabs only render in sticky variant
When tabs are present, they provide the bottom border; without tabs, a subtle border is added automatically
Use Button size="md" for action buttons in the header
Use TabsList variant="line" for the tabs slot
Pass scrollContainerRef if the header is inside a scrollable container other than window

aiHints.context: Use Header as the primary page-level heading component. Default to variant="sticky" for pages with scrollable content. It supports scroll condensation, inline badge and metadata, right-side actions, and tab navigation. Only one Header should appear per page.
